Test Scenario: Login succeeds with valid credentials and active account
Steps to Execute:
1) Open login page
2) Enter valid username/password
3) Click Login
Expected Result: Access granted; user lands on Dashboard; session token issued

Test Scenario: Invalid password is rejected without creating a session
Steps to Execute:
1) Open login page
2) Enter valid username + wrong password
3) Click Login
Expected Result: Error message 'Invalid credentials'; no session created

Test Scenario: Inactive/Locked user cannot login
Steps to Execute: 1) Attempt login with correct credentials for locked user
Expected Result: Error 'Account inactive/locked'; no session created

Test Scenario: Logout terminates the session and requires re-authentication
Steps to Execute:
1) Click Logout
2) Confirm logout
Expected Result: Session terminated; subsequent requests redirect to login

Test Scenario: KPIs load correctly with existing data
Preconditions: At least 1 day of sales and stock data exists
Steps to Execute:
1) Login
2) Navigate to Dashboard
Expected Result: KPIs show revenue, units, low-stock, and near-expiry without errors

Test Scenario: Open a sale receipt and verify items/totals
Preconditions: At least one completed sale exists
Steps to Execute:
1) From Dashboard, open latest sale
2) Review line items and totals
Expected Result: Items, quantities, prices, and totals are accurate

Test Scenario: Add product with valid inputs
Preconditions: User has permission to add products
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Add Product
2) Fill required fields
3) Save
Test Data: name=Apple Fuji; sku=APL-FJ-001; cost=60; price=80; threshold=20
Expected Result: Product is saved and visible in catalog search

Test Scenario: Duplicate SKU/QR is rejected
Preconditions: A product with same SKU/QR exists
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Add Product
2) Enter existing SKU/QR
3) Save
Expected Result: Validation error 'Duplicate SKU/QR'; product not saved

Test Scenario: Min margin rule enforced (price ≥ cost×(1+min_margin))
Steps to Execute:
1) Add product cost=100 price=105
2) Save
Expected Result: Validation error; minimum price must be 110 or higher

Test Scenario: Required fields show clear validation messages
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Add Product
2) Leave required fields blank
3) Save
Expected Result: Field-level messages appear; user guided to fix inputs

Test Scenario: Add stock batch (valid) updates on-hand
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Add Stock
2) Enter batch (qty,cost,mfg,expiry)
3) Save
Expected Result: Batch inserted; on-hand increases; last_addition timestamp set

Test Scenario: Invalid expiry is blocked with message
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Add Stock
2) Enter expiry in the past
3) Save
Expected Result: Validation error; batch not created

Test Scenario: Dashboard reflects stock changes after addition
Steps to Execute:
1) Add stock
2) Navigate/refresh Dashboard
Expected Result: New on-hand visible without inconsistency or delay beyond design

Test Scenario: Record sale with sufficient single-batch stock
Steps to Execute:
1) Start sale
2) Add item qty within one batch
3) Checkout
Expected Result: Sale saved; FIFO decremented; totals correct

Test Scenario: Record sale spanning multiple batches follows FIFO
Steps to Execute:
1) Start sale
2) Add qty > older batch qty
3) Checkout
Expected Result: Older batch consumed first, then newer; on-hand accurate

Test Scenario: Block sale when insufficient stock
Steps to Execute:
1) Start sale
2) Add qty > on-hand
3) Checkout
Expected Result: Sale blocked with 'Insufficient stock'

Test Scenario: Line price equals catalog price at checkout
Steps to Execute:
1) Start sale
2) Add item
3) Checkout
Expected Result: Line price equals current catalog price; totals correct

Test Scenario: Voiding a sale restores batch stock sequence
Preconditions: A sale exists within voidable window
Steps to Execute:
1) Open sale
2) Click Void
3) Confirm
Expected Result: Sale marked Voided; inventory restored to original batches

Test Scenario: Prevent double-void of the same sale
Steps to Execute:
1) Open voided sale
2) Attempt void again
Expected Result: System blocks duplicate void and shows status

Test Scenario: Generate daily report and store summary
Preconditions: Sales & stock movements present for the day
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Reports
2) Select Daily + date
3) Generate
Expected Result: Report stored with opening, added, sold, expired, closing, revenue, margin

Test Scenario: Invalid date range is rejected with clear message
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Reports
2) Set end < start
3) Generate
Expected Result: Validation error; no report generated

Test Scenario: Filter by product limits rows correctly
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Reports
2) Choose product filter
3) Generate
Expected Result: Only selected product appears in report

Test Scenario: Low-stock condition triggers SMS and logs status
Steps to Execute:
1) Reduce stock below threshold
2) Run alert job
Expected Result: SMS sent via gateway; D6 logs 'Queued' → 'Sent/Delivered/Failed'

Test Scenario: Near-expiry batch triggers SMS and logs
Preconditions: Batch within X days to expiry
Steps to Execute:
1) Add batch expiring soon
2) Run alert job
Expected Result: SMS sent and logged with delivery status in D6

Test Scenario: Handle SMS gateway failure with retry and logging
Steps to Execute:
1) Trigger SMS
2) Simulate gateway error
3) Observe retry/log
Expected Result: System retries or marks Failed; D6 updated with error details

Test Scenario: Suggest price based on recent demand with explanation
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Pricing
2) Select product
3) Generate suggestion
Expected Result: Suggested price shown with reason codes (elasticity, R², demand ratio)

Test Scenario: Fallback elasticity used when observations are insufficient
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Pricing for low-data product
2) Generate
Expected Result: Default elasticity applied; confidence LOW in message

Test Scenario: Min margin, stock horizon, and max move enforced
Steps to Execute:
1) Generate suggestion
2) Inspect output
Expected Result: No suggestion violates constraints; action may be HOLD

Test Scenario: Cooldown blocks frequent price changes
Steps to Execute: 1) Generate suggestion for recently changed product
Expected Result: Action shown as HOLD; explanation cites cooldown window

Test Scenario: Price change is applied only after approval
Steps to Execute:
1) Click Approve
2) Confirm action
Expected Result: Catalog price updated; change logged; optional SMS notification

Test Scenario: Update contact information persists
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Profile
2) Edit email/phone
3) Save
Expected Result: Profile saved; confirmation shown

Test Scenario: Password change requires old password and invalidates sessions
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Profile
2) Enter old/new passwords
3) Save
Expected Result: Password updated; other sessions invalidated

Test Scenario: Dashboard loads KPIs within target response time
Steps to Execute:
1) Login
2) Load Dashboard
3) Measure time
Expected Result: Measured time ≤ target; no timeouts

Test Scenario: Daily report generates within SLA
Steps to Execute:
1) Open Reports
2) Generate Daily
3) Measure time
Expected Result: Report generated within SLA; stored in D5

Test Scenario: System handles concurrent cashiers without deadlocks
Steps to Execute:
1) Start 10 concurrent sale sessions
2) Checkout simultaneously
Expected Result: No deadlocks; success rate 100%; response p95 ≤ 3s; inventory consistent

Test Scenario: Under typical load, CPU/memory remain within limits
Steps to Execute:
1) Run standard workload for 30 min
2) Observe metrics
Expected Result: Utilization within limits; no thrashing

Test Scenario: Validation errors are clear and help resolution
Steps to Execute:
1) Submit form with errors
2) Read messages
Expected Result: Messages specify field and rule; focus moves to first error

Test Scenario: First-time user completes key tasks without training
Steps to Execute:
1) Login first time
2) Add product
3) Add stock
4) Record sale
Expected Result: Tasks completed within expected time; no external help needed

Test Scenario: Mid-transaction restart does not duplicate or lose confirmed sales
Steps to Execute:
1) Start sale
2) Force app restart after payment
3) Resume
Expected Result: Exactly one sale recorded; inventory consistent; user notified

Test Scenario: Planned maintenance displays notice and preserves data integrity
Steps to Execute:
1) Start maintenance mode
2) Attempt user actions
Expected Result: Read-only notice shown; writes blocked; no data loss

Test Scenario: Low-stock threshold change via config reflects across modules
Steps to Execute:
1) Change threshold in Settings
2) Add stock/sales
3) Check Dashboard/Alerts
Expected Result: Alerts and flags use new threshold without code change

Test Scenario: Key actions write traceable logs for debugging
Steps to Execute:
1) Add product/stock/sale
2) Generate report
3) Inspect logs
Expected Result: Logs contain action IDs, user, timestamps, references for root-cause analysis

Test Scenario: Direct URL access redirects to login
Steps to Execute: 1) Paste protected URL in browser
Expected Result: Access denied; redirect to /login

Test Scenario: Secretary blocked from Admin-only function
Steps to Execute: 1) Navigate to /products/add
Expected Result: 403 Forbidden or redirect with error

Test Scenario: End-to-end product lifecycle works cleanly
Steps to Execute: 1) Add product 2) Add stock 3) Record sale 4) Generate report
Expected Result: All steps succeed without errors; data consistent

Test Scenario: Every key action writes traceable logs
Steps to Execute: 1) Add product 2) Add stock 3) Record sale 4) Generate report
Expected Result: Logs contain action-ID

Test Scenario: Mid-transaction restart doesn’t duplicate or lose sale
Preconditions: A sale is in payment step
Steps to Execute: 1) Start payment 2) Simulate app restart 3) Resume
Expected Result: Exactly one sale stored; inventory correct; user sees recovery notice
